creator: coad@measurement-factory.com
text:
Looks like a possible RFC 2616 MUST violation.
Cache-control: min-fresh request directive is not
honored.

See attached trace(s) for details and ways to reproduce
the violation mentioned above.

Test case IDs in the trace link to human-oriented test case
description and RFC quotes, if available.

creator: sragavan@novell.com
text:
Created attachment 7078
The Cache-control header was not read from cache. So min-fresh cannot be compared with max-age. So it was failing. Now it is read from cache in to r->headers_out

creator: coad@measurement-factory.com
text:
Created attachment 7124
test case trace, patched 2.0.46

creator: coad@measurement-factory.com
text:
The test case still fails after the proposed
patch is applied to 2.0.46. The corresponding
case trace is attached.

I'm going through the bug db to make sure patches are findable.  Please see 
http://httpd.apache.org/dev/patches.html
creator: trawick@apache.org
jerenkrantz@apache.org
text:
This should be resolved in the latest release of httpd.

Thanks!

creator: coad@measurement-factory.com
text:
Created attachment 15316
trace with httpd-2.0.54

Looks like the same violation is still in httpd-2.0.54.

creator: coad@measurement-factory.com
text:
Reopening this bug because it does not look
like the violation was fixed in 2004 (or
perhaps the bug re-appeared).

text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 19441 ***
